query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 In su l’estremità d’un’alta ripa 2 che facevan gran pietre rotte in cerchio, 3 venimmo sopra più crudele stipa;
query.error: **English:** 1 On the edge of a high cliff 2 made of large broken rocks in a circle, 3 we came upon a more cruel throng;
query.result: 1 Uccaiḥ śikharasya ante 2 yaḥ mahāśilākhaṇḍaiḥ paridhiḥ kṛtaḥ āsīt, 3 tatra vayam adhikaṃ nṛśaṃsaṃ samūhaṃ prāpama,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 e quivi, per l’orribile soperchio 5 del puzzo che ’l profondo abisso gitta, 6 ci raccostammo, in dietro, ad un coperchio
query.error: **English:** 4 and there, because of the horrible stench 5 that the deep abyss cast forth, 6 we drew back to a lid
query.result: 4 atra ca, ghoraṃ durgaṃdhaṃ 5 yam gambhīraḥ khaṇḍaḥ kṣipati, 6 tasmāt paścāt, ekaṃ śilāpaṭṭikāṃ prati

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 d’un grand’ avello, ov’ io vidi una scritta 8 che dicea: ‘Anastasio papa guardo, 9 lo qual trasse Fotin de la via dritta’.
query.error: **English:** 7 of a large tomb, where I saw an inscription 8 that said: ‘Pope Anastasius I guard, 9 whom Photinus drew from the straight path’.
query.result: 7 ekaṃ bṛhat khaḍgam, yatra aham ekaṃ likhitam apaśyam, 8 yat āha: ‘Anāstāsiyaḥ pāpaḥ rakṣāmi, 9 yaḥ Photīnaḥ satpathamārgāt apahṛtaḥ āsīt’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 «Lo nostro scender conviene esser tardo, 11 sì che s’ausi un poco in prima il senso 12 al tristo fiato; e poi no i fia riguardo».
query.error: **English:** 10 "Our descent must be cautious, 11 so that the sense may grow somewhat accustomed 12 to the foul air; and then it will not matter."
query.result: 10 "Avasarjanam asmākam bhavitavyam vilambitam, 11 yathā śaknoti indriyam alpameva ādau 12 durvāsaye; tataḥ tena na dṛṣṭiḥ bhaviṣyati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Così ’l maestro; e io «Alcun compenso», 14 dissi lui, «trova che ’l tempo non passi 15 perduto». Ed elli: «Vedi ch’a ciò penso».
query.error: **English:** 13 Thus the master; and I, "Find some remedy," 14 I said to him, "so that the time may not pass 15 in vain." And he: "See how I am thinking about that."
query.result: 13 Evam gurur aha, aham ca, "Kacit prāyaścittam", 14 uvāca tasmai, "anveṣaya yena kālaḥ na gacchet 15 vyartham". Sa ca, "Paśya katham aham tatra cintayāmi".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 «Figliuol mio, dentro da cotesti sassi», 17 cominciò poi a dir, «son tre cerchietti 18 di grado in grado, come que’ che lassi.
query.error: **English:** 16 "My son, within these stones," 17 he then began to say, "are three circles, 18 each smaller than the last, like those that tire.
query.result: 16 "Putra mama, antarebhyaḥ eṣām aśmānām," 17 tataḥ ārabhya vaktuṃ prārabhata, "triḥ paridhiḥ santi, 18 kramaśaḥ kramaśaḥ, yathā te klāntāḥ bhavanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Tutti son pien di spirti maladetti; 20 ma perché poi ti basti pur la vista, 21 intendi come e perché son costretti.
query.error: **English:** 19 All of them are filled with evil spirits; 20 but so that the sight of them may suffice you, 21 understand how and why they are constrained.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 D’ogne malizia, ch’odio in cielo acquista, 23 ingiuria è ’l fine, ed ogne fin cotale 24 o con forza o con frode altrui contrista.
query.error: **English:** 22 Of all wickedness, which hatred acquires in heaven, 23 injury is the end, and every such end 24 either by force or fraud brings sorrow to others.
query.result: 22 Sarvasyāduritasya, yat dveṣaḥ svarge āpnoti, 23 aparādha eva antaḥ, ca sarvaḥ antaḥ etadṛśaḥ 24 vā balena vā chalena paraṃ kleśayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Ma perché frode è de l’uom proprio male, 26 più spiace a Dio; e però stan di sotto 27 li frodolenti, e più dolor li assale.
query.error: **English:** 25 But because fraud is man's own special evil, 26 it is more displeasing to God; and therefore the fraudulent are placed lower, 27 and a greater pain assails them.
query.result: 25 Api ca yataḥ chalaḥ puruṣasya svabhāva eva, 26 tataḥ sa adhikam iṣṭaḥ na bhavati īśvarasya; atas eva adhastana sthitāḥ bhavanti, 27 tathā ca adhikam duḥkham tāḍayati tānaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Di vïolenti il primo cerchio è tutto; 29 ma perché si fa forza a tre persone, 30 in tre gironi è distinto e costrutto.
query.error: **English:** 28 The first circle is entirely of the violent; 29 but because force is done to three persons, 30 it is divided and constructed into three rings.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 A Dio, a sé, al prossimo si pòne 32 far forza, dico in loro e in lor cose, 33 come udirai con aperta ragione.
query.error: **English:** 31 To God, to oneself, and to one's neighbor one can 32 do violence, I say in their persons and in their things, 33 as you will hear with clear reasoning.
query.result: 31 Devāya, ātmane, parasmāicaiva 32 Himsāṃ kartaṃ śakyate, vadāmi tatra tatra vastuni ca, 33 Yathā śṛṇuṣva sphuṭayuktyā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Morte per forza e ferute dogliose 35 nel prossimo si danno, e nel suo avere 36 ruine, incendi e tollette dannose;
query.error: **English:** 34 Violent death and painful wounds 35 are inflicted on one's neighbor, and to his possessions 36 ruin, fires, and harmful thefts;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 onde omicide e ciascun che mal fiere, 38 guastatori e predon, tutti tormenta 39 lo giron primo per diverse schiere.
query.error: **English:** 37 therefore murderers and all who inflict evil wounds, 38 ravagers and plunderers, all are tormented 39 in the first circle, in different bands.
query.result: 37 Ata eva hatyākaraḥ sarvaś ca yo durātmā abhighātayati, 38 Naśayitāraḥ apahartāraś ca, sarve pīḍyante 39 Prathamaṃ maṇḍalaṃ vividhaiḥ gaṇaiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Puote omo avere in sé man vïolenta 41 e ne’ suoi beni; e però nel secondo 42 giron convien che sanza pro si penta
query.error: **English:** 40 A man can exercise violent power over himself 41 and his possessions; and therefore in the second 42 circle it is necessary that he repent without avail,
query.result: 40 Puruṣaḥ svayam eva ātmāni hiṃsāṃ kartaṃ śaknoti 41 evaṃ ca tasya vastuni; atas tu dvitīye 42 maṇḍale anarthakameva prāyaścittam kartavyam,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 qualunque priva sé del vostro mondo, 44 biscazza e fonde la sua facultade, 45 e piange là dov’ esser de’ giocondo.
query.error: **English:** 43 whoever deprives himself of your world, 44 squanders and destroys his faculty, 45 and weeps there where he should be joyful.
query.result: 43 yaḥ kaścit svayam eva bhavataḥ jagataḥ parityāgam karoti, 44 svakīyaṃ śaktiṃ vināśayati vinipātayati ca, 45 sa tatra eva rodate yatra sukham anubhavitum arhati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Puossi far forza ne la deïtade, 47 col cor negando e bestemmiando quella, 48 e spregiando natura e sua bontade;
query.error: **English:** 46 You can exert force against the deity, 47 by denying and blaspheming it in your heart, 48 and scorning nature and its goodness;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 e però lo minor giron suggella 50 del segno suo e Soddoma e Caorsa 51 e chi, spregiando Dio col cor, favella.
query.error: **English:** 49 and therefore the lowest circle seals 50 with its mark Sodom and Cahors 51 and those who, scorning God in their hearts, speak.
query.result: 49 atas ca adhamaḥ paridhiḥ mudrayati 50 svakīyena lakṣaṇena Sodom ca Caorsa ca 51 yaś ca, hṛdayena devam avajñāya, bruvate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 La frode, ond’ ogne coscïenza è morsa, 53 può l’omo usare in colui che ’n lui fida 54 e in quel che fidanza non imborsa.
query.error: **English:** 52 Fraud, by which every conscience is bitten, 53 a man can practice on one who trusts him 54 and in whom he places no trust.
query.result: 52 Chalaḥ, yena sarvam vijñānam daṣṭam asti, 53 sa puruṣaḥ prayoktavyaḥ yasmin puruṣe viśvāsaḥ asti, 54 yasmin ca viśvāsam na karoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.error: **English:** 55 This way of going backward seems to cut off 56 even the love that nature makes; 57 therefore in the second circle nestle

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 ipocresia, lusinghe e chi affattura, 59 falsità, ladroneccio e simonia, 60 ruffian, baratti e simile lordura.

query.result: 58 dambhaḥ, prasādaḥ, abhicāraḥ ca, 59 mṛṣāvādaḥ, steyam, vikrayo brahmaṇasya ca, 60 kuṭṭanī, vyavahārikāḥ, tathānyā malinaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.error: **English:** 61 For the other way that love is forgotten 62 which nature makes, and that which is then added, 63 from which special faith is created;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 onde nel cerchio minore, ov’ è ’l punto 65 de l’universo in su che Dite siede, 66 qualunque trade in etterno è consunto».
query.error: **English:** 64 so that in the smaller circle, where is the point 65 of the universe on which Dis sits, 66 whoever betrays is eternally consumed.
query.result: 64 yataḥ kṣudra-maṇḍale, yatra asti 65 viśvasya binduḥ yasmin Diteḥ āsanaṃ, 66 yaḥ kaścit vyāpāraḥ karoti sa nityaṃ dagdhaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 E io: «Maestro, assai chiara procede 68 la tua ragione, e assai ben distingue 69 questo baràtro e ’l popol ch’e’ possiede.
query.error: **English:** 67 And I: "Master, your reasoning proceeds very clearly, 68 and you distinguish very well 69 this abyss and the people who possess it.
query.result: 67 Aham ca: "He gurudeva, atisphuṭam pravartate 68 tava yuktiḥ, ati ca suṣṭhu vivecayasi 69 imam khaṇḍagāṃ tathā janaṃ yaḥ asyām vartate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Ma dimmi: quei de la palude pingue, 71 che mena il vento, e che batte la pioggia, 72 e che s’incontran con sì aspre lingue,

query.result: 70 Api tu mama vaktavyam: ye asmin pinguṇe palvale sthitāḥ, 71 yeṣām vāyuḥ pravahati, yeṣām varṣā patati, 72 ye ca parasparam tīkṣṇaiḥ śabdaiḥ vivadante,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 perché non dentro da la città roggia 74 sono ei puniti, se Dio li ha in ira? 75 e se non li ha, perché sono a tal foggia?».
query.error: **English:** 73 why are they not punished inside the city moat, 74 if God is angry with them? 75 And if he is not, why are they in such a state?
query.result: 73 te kimartham na daṇḍyante nagara-parikhāyāḥ antarbhāge, 74 yadi Devaḥ taiḥ kopitaḥ asti? 75 Yadi ca na kopitaḥ, kimartham taiḥ ayam daśā prāptā?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Ed elli a me «Perché tanto delira», 77 disse, «lo ’ngegno tuo da quel che sòle? 78 o ver la mente dove altrove mira?
query.error: **English:** 76 And he said to me, "Why do you wander so deliriously, 77 your intellect turned from its usual path? 78 Or is your mind fixed elsewhere?
query.result: 76 Sa ca mama "Kimartham evam vikṣipyasi", 77 uvāca, "tattvam tava yathāvat? 78 Api vā manaḥ anyatra avalokayate?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Non ti rimembra di quelle parole 80 con le quai la tua Etica pertratta 81 le tre disposizion che ’l ciel non vole,
query.error: **English:** 79 Do you not remember those words 80 with which your Ethics treats 81 the three dispositions that Heaven does not will,
query.result: 79 Na smarasi tāni vacāṁsi 80 yābhiḥ tava Nītiśāstraṃ vivṛtam 81 tās tridhā vṛttayaḥ yāḥ svarge na icchanti,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 incontenenza, malizia e la matta 83 bestialitade? e come incontenenza 84 men Dio offende e men biasimo accatta?
query.error: **English:** 82 incontinence, malice, and mad 83 bestiality? And how incontinence 84 offends God less and incurs less blame?
query.result: 82 asamyamaḥ, dainyaṃ ca, unmādaś ca 83 paśubhāvaḥ? Asamyamaḥ ca katham 84 alpam devam avajānāti alpam ca nindām ādadāti?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Se tu riguardi ben questa sentenza, 86 e rechiti a la mente chi son quelli 87 che sù di fuor sostegnon penitenza,
query.error: **English:** 85 If you consider this judgment well, 86 and recall to mind who those are 87 who outside endure penance,
query.result: 85 Yadi tvam imam nyāyam samyak paśyasi, 86 ca smaryasi ye te 87 ye bahiḥ prāyaścittam kurvanti,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 tu vedrai ben perché da questi felli 89 sien dipartiti, e perché men crucciata 90 la divina vendetta li martelli».
query.error: **English:** 88 you will see clearly why these wretches 89 are separated from them, and why divine vengeance 90 torments them less."
query.result: 88 tadā tvam samyak drakṣyasi kimartham etebhyaḥ pāpebhyaḥ 89 vivicyante, kimartham ca alpam kṣobhayati 90 daivī pratikriyā etān."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 «O sol che sani ogne vista turbata, 92 tu mi contenti sì quando tu solvi, 93 che, non men che saver, dubbiar m’aggrata.
query.error: **English:** 91 O sun, who heals every troubled sight, 92 you satisfy me so when you rise, 93 that, no less than knowing, doubting delights me.
query.result: 91 He sūryaḥ yaḥ sarvāṇi cakṣur-vyathitāni svāsthyam āpādayati, 92 tvam eva māṃ tṛpnoti yadā tvam udayasi, 93 yataḥ jñānena na alpam saṃśayena ca mama āhlādo jāyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Ancora in dietro un poco ti rivolvi», 95 diss’ io, «là dove di’ ch’usura offende 96 la divina bontade, e ’l groppo solvi».
query.error: **English:** 94 "Turn back a little further," 95 I said, "to where you say usury offends 96 the divine goodness, and untie the knot."
query.result: 94 Api punaḥ paścāt kimcid viparivarta, 95 iti ahaṃ, "yatra vadasi yatra vṛttir apakarṣaṇī 96 daivīm śubhatām, tatraiva granthim vimocarṣa."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 «Filosofia», mi disse, «a chi la ’ntende, 98 nota, non pure in una sola parte, 99 come natura lo suo corso prende
query.error: **English:** 97 "Philosophy," she said to me, "to one who understands it, 98 reveals, and not in one part only, 99 how nature takes its course
query.result: 97 "Darśanam," sā mama avocat, "yaḥ paśyati, 98 jānāti, na kevalam ekena bhāgena, 99 katham prakṛtiḥ svayam gacchati

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 dal divino ’ntelletto e da sua arte; 101 e se tu ben la tua Fisica note, 102 tu troverai, non dopo molte carte,
query.error: **English:** 100 from the divine intellect and from its art; 101 and if you study your Physics well, 102 you will find, not many pages hence,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 che l’arte vostra quella, quanto pote, 104 segue, come ’l maestro fa ’l discente; 105 sì che vostr’ arte a Dio quasi è nepote.
query.error: **English:** 103 that your art follows that of nature, as much as it can, 104 just as the student follows the master; 105 so that your art is, as it were, the grandchild of God.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Da queste due, se tu ti rechi a mente 107 lo Genesì dal principio, convene 108 prender sua vita e avanzar la gente;
query.error: **English:** 106 From these two, if you recall to mind 107 the Genesis from the beginning, it is fitting 108 to take their life and advance the people;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 e perché l’usuriere altra via tene, 110 per sé natura e per la sua seguace 111 dispregia, poi ch’in altro pon la spene.
query.error: **English:** 109 and because the usurer takes another way, 110 he despises nature for himself and for his followers, 111 since he places his hope in something else.
query.result: 109 Tathāpi kṛtakāriṇī anyām gatim gacchati, 110 Svārtham eva prakṛtiṃ ca anuyāyinaṃ ca 111 Avajānāti, anyatra hi āśām dadhāti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

115 e ’l balzo via là oltra si dismonta».
